inn1.comm: starts off on the pads and that's a freebie for Marsh, who only has to get a little bit of bat on ball and its down to fine leg for four
better ball, angling across Marsh off a full length and he leaves
good shot, pitches on the stumps and Marsh on-drives rather sweetly, but Albie falls across at mid-on and intercepts the shot, well stopped there
139ks, pitches and angles across and then bounces and deviates a lot and it takes a leaping effort from Boucher to stop it running away
a push into the covers and some good running gets him one
good stuff, hitting a great length and seaming across to beat the bat
pitches full and Warner drives to extra cover to get off the mark
pitches full to invite the drive, Warner chases and gets beat on the shot
another swing and miss, pitched up full and wide and Warner wafts
better stuff, just back of a length outside off and Warner has to defend
tucks him up with a short one, which Warner defends to midwicket
pitches it up outside off and he drives and misses as it swings away
again back of a length and Warner defends it to point

chipped straight to mid-on! Ntini continues to mix up his deliveries well, slipping one in full and straighter and swinging it back into Warner, who goes for a flick but finds Morne Morkel stationed inside the circle, so that is an early breakthrough for Ntini in his first over
pitches full and wide and Ponting shoulders arms
full and straight and Marsh clips it off his pads square on the leg side
awesome! Steyn now gives Marsh width on the off side and he punches a sweet drive past extra cover, no one could move as the ball screeched away
back of a length and seaming across and he leaves it be
pitched up full, Marsh goes for an off-drive and inside-edges to leg

good catch! Steyn angles it full and wide across Marsh, who flings the bat at the width but ends up slashing it off the toe end of the bat over backward point, Morne Morkel runs in from third man and dives forward to hold an excellent take, his second in consecutive overs
pitches full and wide and he shoulders arms again
pitches full and Hussey dabs into the covers to get of the mark
lovely shot from Ponting, just coming early onto the front foot and taking it on the half-volley, driving elegantly through the covers, he plays that shot really well
rubbish ball, short and swinging way down the pads and Ponting clips it away past a tumbling de Villiers, who had no chance of getting to it
beats him this time, holding back the length and Ponting has a waft outside off stump, feet not to the pitch, and the ball jags back
better area to pitch it in, and the late movement back in moves the ball very close to the top of off stump as Ponting shoulders arms to it
drifts down and he clips it down to fine leg to end the over
138ks, pitches and seams away and Hussey leaves it be
143.8ks, held back and angles across and he leaves again
back of a length on middle and off and he defends to cover
pitches full and goes across outside off and he leaves it be
pitched up wide again and Hussey watches it go by to de Villiers
dragged in a bit short and he pulls it through square on the leg side
141ks, pitched up outside off and he shoulders arms
again he gets too much swing and the ball drifts down the pads
pitches on the stumps, pushed into the covers, where Gibbs dives
goes for a big shot outside off but mistimes it, chopping to point
change of pace, full on off stump, Ponting pushes hard at it off the front foot and gets an inside edge back past leg stump, he was trying to go for it on the rise
good bowling again, hitting a length on off to get him defending
straighter one and he clips it just wide of midwicket
again too straight and Ponting flicks it out to Morne in the deep

big shout for leg before, pitches fullish and seams back in to beat Ponting's bat as he pushes down the line, he didn't get a big stride forward and is hit just outside the off stump, and when I say just I mean just ... the umpire Ian Gould figured he had gotten safely across, but my that was close
pitches on middle and off and he plays it to midwicket loosely
invites the drive and Ponting comes forward and cannot beat cover
tidy stuff again, pitching and straightening and he defends
slower ball, full and swinging, and he clips it to midwicket
good shot, comes onto the front foot and pushes on the rise through square, Duminy gives chase downhill and retrieves the ball
pitches on a length and he defends firmly to the off side
keeps him quiet again, not offering room and Ponting defends
pitches wider and Ponting commits himself onto the front foot, reaching out and square-driving it uppishly between cover and point and gets another boundary
shorter and he gets back and carves it backward of point, well played
bang, that's four! Dropped in short and in a flash he pulls it over midwicket
pitches outside off and he leaves it be
lands outside off again and he runs it down to third man
hits a length and deviates it and he shoulders arms
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot back to the bowler
similar length, on off stump, Hussey jabs it towards cover
some more width provided this time, Hussey drives, but doesn't best the man at cover
and he is welcomed in with a spanking pull shot from Ponting, swiveling and hitting the short ball superbly past midwicket
pitches full, expectedly, to get him pushing off the front foot to cover
much better length, on the seam, getting Ponting defending
lovely shot, just pushing the ball straight down the ground
another pleasing drive off the front foot to cover, where Duminy misfields and allows Ponting a single, and my is he looking dangerous today is Ponting
full on middle and off and flicked past midwicket, where Morne runs after it and dives to flick it back in, but they manage to run four in the process
hits a length and beats him first ball, Ponting pushing and missing
another good shot, Ponting easing forward and square-driving for one
low full toss and Hussey pats it back to Morne, who fields easily
oversteps, its a good ball that deviates off the upright seam to get Hussey shouldering arms outside off stump, but its also a free hit
of all things he bowls a full toss, Hussey swings it out to the deep, not getting hold of it, the ball drops safely and Duminy leaps up to collect it on the rebound
pitched up and Ponting pushes it off the front foot to cover
on the pads, asking for trouble, but he clips it straight to Amla
lovely drive there off the front foot, but well stopped at cover too
hits a middle-and-leg length to cramp Hussey, who deflects it to gully

what are they doing out there? Albie serves it up full and gets some swing, Ponting drives away from the body off the front foot and gets an outside edge to de Villiers, but there is no confident appeal ... de Villiers collects and sort of says something very unconvincingly ... that was a clear edge .... I cannot believe that!
on the stumps and played to Amla at midwicket
a loose drive away from the body, in the air between cover and point
hits a good length and he pushes it to extra cover
pitches on the stumps and he clips the ball to mid-on
pitches on a length and he drives the ball to the off side
pitches and swings away, Ponting goes to hit it down the ground but gets a leading edge over the off side, basically spooning it in the air
hits a length and he turns it away for one
pitched up and he hammers it powerfully down past mid-off, bang
hits a length and nips back and he defends awkwardly
pitches fullish outside off stump and he drives into the covers
hits a length and he defends it to the off side
hits a length and he pushes it to cover
a tip-and-run towards backward point, Hussey sets off, Ponting sells him down the river, he turns and head back, Gibbs swoops across and misses the stumps
pitches on a length and he pushes the ball toward cover
now he goes downtown, just hitting through the line over mid-on, hit high in the air, one bounce and four and he moves to 49
sliding on to the pads, Hussey works it away towards square leg for a single
overpitched outside off, Ponting reaches out and drives towards deep cover to reach his fifty
slightly short of a length, thuds into Michael Hussey's thigh pad
almost a replay of the previous ball, Hussey was looking to turn it away to square leg, hits his pads
incoming delivery, defended off the back foot to silly mid-on
Spoils what had been a fine over so far with a no-ball, again targetting Hussey's leg stump, the batsman can't get bat on it
Whack! Hussey loves that midwicket boundary, Morkel drops it short, and Hussey clobbers it into the crowd
starts off with a flighted ball, pitching just outside off, Ponting defends it to the leg side
drops it short this time, pitching on middle and the turn takes it past leg, Ponting helps it towards fine leg for a couple
short again, a touch outside off, Ponting pulls it towards square leg
played towards short midwicket
on the pads, Ponting helps himself to an easy single after punching it down to long-on
nice length, a bit of width outside off, Hussey defends towards mid-off
room on offer and he laces that backward of point, out to where Albie dives superbly and cuts off the boundary
143.4ks, pitched up outside off and he leaves it alone
pitches on off stump and swings, pushed to the cover fielder
driven straight down the track, sweetly, but Morne sticks a hand out
short and wide and cut out to the deep cover boundary patroller
pitches on the stumps and swings in, pushed to midwicket
tossed up, turns in, glided to backward point, where Amla fields
tossed up and he gets well forward and pushes to the off side
flat on middle and leg and knocked to the on side for one more
spins back in from wide of off stump, Ponting waits for turn and then dabs it wide of backward point, calling immediately for the single
pitches a tad straighter and Hussey gets back to turn it for one
pitches on middle and leg and straightens, Ponting shuffles across and ends up playing the ball down to mid-on, who slides and fields to cut off the single
well played by Hussey, collecting on the rise and piercing the covers
pitches wide to bring Ponting onto the front foot, he eases a push through the gap between cover and point and continues to prosper
too straight and he clips a single off the pads, as easy as they come
pitches a foot outside off stump and gets some good carry to de Villiers, Ponting comes onto the front foot and shoulders arms
this one is on the stumps and Ponting pats it back to Morne
goes a bit straighter and that one is turned in the air past midwicket
tossed up to get him well forward, steering the ball wide of point

lbw! Botha tosses it up on the stumps, purchases some drift, Hussey gets across to paddle it around the corner, but there's no bat on that and after an imploring appeal the umpire raises the finger of fate
tossed up on off stump, he shuffles and turns it to square leg
a tad short and he swivels it to a tumbling square leg
tossed up, he uses his feet and drives to mid-on for one
pitches on the stumps and he wrists it toward square leg
full and a bit wide, he reaches out and mistimes the shot to point
now he makes better contact and dabs the ball into the off side
pushed off the front foot to cover, where Duminy dives and saves runs
hits this one into the gap between cover and point and sets off
Ntini strikes, pitching the slower offcutter on a length and Ponting chases it on the rise, hitting it straight to McKenzie stationed at short catching cover
full and swinging in and he drives with an inside edge to midwicket
tossed up on the stumps and he pats it back softly
flatter just outside off stump and driven to the off side
shorter ball forces him onto the back foot and he defends
flighted up on the stumps and Haddin punches it down the ground
uses his feet and wrists to clip that down toward mid-on
tossed up and played back to Botha
pitches it up wide to invite the airy shot and and Hussey flashes a drive off the front foot, in the air wide of cover, and no stopping that
lovely little punch off the front foot, not a half-volley but Hussey goes after the wide one and bisects two fielders to get another pleasing boundary
just back of a length and he defends solidly toward point
126.6ks, short of a length outside off and no shot offered
slides down the pads and de Villiers does the collecting
gets to the pitch and drives to cover, where the fielder dives and saves
back of a length outside off and he shoulders arms in peace
goes back and across and plays the ball in front of square leg
flatter one and Haddin gets onto the back foot to play it back
on the stumps and now Haddin punches it on the rise to mid-on
tossed up slower, starts to dip and Hussey clips it past midwicket

and he throws it away with a stupid shot! Botha gets a second, lobbing it up to tempt the big shot, Haddin cannot resist and miscues the slog out to Kallis who settles under it at deep midwicket just in front of the boundary
ah well bowled! Botha slips it in just outside off stump, Hussey lunges forward and misses, he just had his back leg in time, beaten in the flight from Botha
135ks, back of a length and White defends it back
a tad fuller and angling back in, White defends to the off side
pitches and angles back in, White pushes at it and gets an edge safely wide of slip and down to third man
pitches back of a length and gets good bounce and White leaves
inches forward and lunges at this one, dead-batting it back to Ntini
angles back in and he pushes at it again, running to backward point
short ball drifting down, Hussey plays a sweep but to the fielder
pushed through fuller and quicker and Hussey drives to midwicket
spins down from middle and leg and he defends to the on side
that pitches fuller on about off stump and White defends to cover
low full toss and he clips it to midwicket, failing to beat Gibbs
tossed up outside off stump, slower, and he pushes it to the off side
pitches outside off stump and he steers the ball past point
straighter ball, turned to Duminy at midwicket
pitches it up full and he squeezes the drive to short cover
pushes forward off the front foot and nudges the ball to short cover
full toss on the stumps, he just turns it to square leg for one
overpitched on the toes and flicked out to deep square for one more
drives a fullish delivery to the off side, cannot beat cover
this one drifts down the pads and he turns it wide of midwicket
slower through the air, pitching on leg, White inside-edges to the on side
angled down and he paddles the ball to short fine leg
full on middle and leg, Hussey flicks it straight to midwicket
low full toss on the pads and he mistimes it to McKenzie at square leg
short of a length outside off stump, steered toward point
sweetly hit down the ground, off the middle of the bat, and it flies away over the infield, that was in the slot White just lofted through the line for four
change of pace nearly does him, White rolls the wrists and chips the ball in the air in front of mid-on
fuller outside off stump and he plays a conservative forward defensive
a bit too straight and White turns it wide of square leg, all wrists
more positive strokeplay from Hussey, steering this past cover-point
full on leg stump and flicked out to deep midwicket
slower delivery, off stumpish, White gets across to paddle it around the corner but cannot make good contact, the ball hits the toe of the bat and stops dead
tossed up generously and he defends solidly
pitches on middle and off and he plays it to midwicket
slips out a low full toss on the pads but White just bunts it to midwicket
full again and another single, clipped through the on side
bounces him this time and he pulls from outside off stump, just into the ground wide of a diving midwicket
follows up with a full one, which he clips from off stump to midwicket
slower ball does the trick! Albie pitches it up to draw a loose drive from Hussey straight into the lap of Gibbs at short cover, who makes no mistake when holding it
back of a length, just outside off, pushed towards cover, and the batsmen pinch a quick single, Hopes could have been run out if there was a direct hit
nice, tight line on off, White defends off the back foot to the bowler
hits a length and he keeps the last ball out
pitches on the stumps and he turns it to midwicket
again he drives down the ground but cannot beat mid-on
uses his feet and just manages to beat the fielder this time
tossed up and he works the ball off his pads for a single
lobbed up gently, he gets across and turns the ball away
comes well forward and plays a very compact forward defensive
tossed up gently and defended watchfully
drifts a tad wider and he pokes it toward gully, sprinting hard
tossed up and Hopes collects on the volley, punching past mid-off
pushes at that one and gets an inside-edge back down the track
flights it up and he gets over it to defend it back to Duminy
flights it just outside off stump, making White come get it, and he pushes awkwardly to the off side, thats good bowling from Duminy
a touch short and he makes room to punch that past cover
slower ball, thrown up there and it dips on White, who checks the shot
again he lobs it up and now White manages to drive past cover
throws it up invitingly, White gets down to sweep but misses, ball hits his forearm, then pops up to his chin and finally settles down near his back boot, what a mess
drifts full on the pads and White clips it out to deep midwicket
throws it up on the stumps and he pushes the ball to the fielder
tossed up on the stumps and driven straight to midwicket
drifts down the pads and he turns it around the corner to square leg
lands on the stumps and he now glances it away for one
gets to the pitch and punches down the ground
reaches out for it and closes the face, nearly giving cover a catch
tossed up straighter and White clips, but cannot beat midwicket
pitches fullish and Hopes drives between cover and point for one
a bit shorter in length and he steers that safely down to third man
short of a length outside off, Hopes hops back and pokes it to point, sets off and had Gibbs hit with that throw he would have been gone, great fielding though to get there in time to collect
pitches fullish and White defends to the off side
pitches on the stumps and he drops his head to defend
pitches on middle and tails in, White defends it back
tossed up outside off stump and he drives to the off side
tossed up again and he plays the ball to the off side
gives it some air, White reaches out and thumps that down the ground
spins back in sharply to Hopes, who backs away and just gets bat on it
shuffles back again and clips a fuller delivery to midwicket
now he's seen enough and gets down to send that one rows back over deep midwicket, just getting down and hitting with the turn for an impressive shot
pitched up full outside off, slower ball, square-driven to the fielder
gets some room and opens the face, steering it behind point
slower ball, hitting a length and he gently dabs it in front of cover, calling for the quick single and some excellent hustling gets them it as well
back of a length and he pushes it to the off side again
pitches on a length and he dabs the ball into the gaps
full and wide and he flings the bat at it, connecting only with air
pitches full on the stumps and he presents a full face back
nips back in off the seam and White jabs it down to backward point
overpitches on White's pads and he clips it away for a single
pulls a short ball from outside off out to Ntini running across in the deep
another swing and a miss, this time from Hopes, who backs away in an attempt to flay the ball over the off side
change of pace, 119ks, turned off the stumps to deep square  leg
good shot, backing away and getting over a short one with a wristy punch
gets up and steers a shortish one down to third man for one
makes room and drives the fullish ball out to deep cover
slower ball just outside off stump and he maneuvers it to third man
a tad fuller and he punches it down past the stumps for a single
comes forward and pushes the ball toward extra cover for a sixth single
Steyn strikes, inviting the big shot and White chases the wide one from the crease and edges a simple catch to de Villiers, sashaying to his right
bouncer first up, 148ks, and Johnson flinches as he gets low
good ball, nipping across the bat at 149ks, Johnson plays down the wrong line and misses
short of a length on off stump and defended straight to point
back of a length and he punches it off the back foot to cover
full down the pads and he gets a tickle on it, down to deep fine leg
pitches and goes across with the Ntini angle, Johnson leave it be
a nothing shot, just leaning in and hitting straight to Morne at mid-off
pitches on a length and defends solidly to the off side
comes back with the angle and he defends it back to Ntini
slower ball on the stumps and Hilfenhaus defends it back
angles a bit too straight and he uses the wrists to clip toward mid-on
makes room and slices it between point and gully out to sweeper
slower ball, commits him forward and he edges safely to third man
flashes the bat at a wider one and edges to third man again
beats the bat, hits a length and straighten, cutting him in half
pitches on a length and he loosely pushes to the off side, one-handed
frees the arms to slash it square but cannot connect again
pitches on the stumps, and he defends it back to the bowler
comes onto the front foot and drives the ball to the covers
gets to the pitch and steers the ball to the off side again
140ks, slanting into leg stump and he drives it down the ground
pitched up and Hilfenhaus drives it into the covers
tidy end to a tidy over, Ntini angles it back in and the batsman defends
makes room and cuts that past point on the off side
148.7ks, back of a length and Hilfenhaus pokes it to point
makes room again and chops the ball into the off side
smacked! Hopes picks the slower ball, backs away to leg stump, and goes through with a lovely flick over midwicket for half a dozen
more fun from Hopes, moving back and slicing the full ball to deep point
jumps away towards the on side and steers the ball to third man
slips in a yorker to Hopes, who backs away and drives and gets an inside edge past leg stump down to deep fine leg
again into the blockhole and bunted down to mid-on
slower ball, wide of the stumps and steered to backward point
clean strike, creating room and biffing that over extra cover
pitches full on leg stump, again Hopes goes inside-out to mid-off
pitches from wide and beats the bat, that was all about the angle
backs away one time too many and slices the ball off the toe end of the bat to McKenzie, taking a step back at cover to pouch the offering just at the circle
pitches on a length just outside off, Tait moves back and runs it fine
has a waft at a short ball and fails to make contact
slides down the pads and strikes him clearly outside the stumps
angling into the pads again and he clips it down to deep square
ah, that was close, it pitched fullish and angled back in and he cut a cramped shot from just on top of off stump and into the cover and point region
hit on the rise to cover, backing away again
moves away and hits the ball to the off side, mid-off does the fielding
140ks, he goes back and steers it to Gibbs at backward point
wafts at a short delivery off the back foot, missing completely
slips in the attempted yorker, Tait makes room and hits it over the bowler's head, not a bad shot at all and he and Hilfenhaus scamper three
and its all over, as Hilfenhaus pokes at one outside off stump and gets a faint edge back to de Villiers, moving to his left

inn2.comm: a touch shot from Amla, hopping up and nudging the ball off his pads into the gap at square leg, the fielder runs after it and returns a good flat throw to Haddin
bad ball, sprayed a mile down the pads and Haddin has to hustle
145ks, pitched up and Gibbs pushes it to extra cover for one
150.5ks, hits a length and goes the other way, Amla pokes it to backward point
150ks, banged in short and he drops his hands to leave it be
148ks, back of a length and Amla defends it to cover
lovely shot, Tait pitches it up wider and Amla bisects the covers
pitched up outside the stumps and Gibbs pushes to cover
gets across and works a straighter delivery to midwicket
sumptuous, Hilfenhaus delivers the outswinger and Gibbs bunts it with a straight bat past mid-off and extra cover, all along the ground
after the caress comes the club, just hitting it in the air over extra cover for a one-bounce four, the Gibbs specialty on view
now he's carried away, pulling and missing a shorter one
pitched up on a length and he pushes the ball to extra cover
errant delivery slides down the leg side and more work for Haddin
pitched up outside off with some gentle wobble and Amla leaves
comes onto the front foot to drive to cover, who allows a couple
152ks short on the body and he shuffles to turn it to square leg
pitches short of a length and he gets in line to block it back
full and swinging back in and he clips it past midwicket

loud appeal for lbw, Tait slides it down and angles toward leg stump, Amla is beaten on the shot and hit on the front pad, they all ask the question but it was doing a bit too much and the umpire walks away to the off side, replays show the ball didn't straighten and would have brushed leg stump
good use of the feet, waltzing down and hitting over extra cover
short of a length and Gibbs defends it to the off side
skips down and clips this one in the air over midwicket
120.6ks, outside leg stump and turned to square leg
plays a cramped attempt of a pull of sorts, that was not a short enough ball and he is hit on the thigh above the stumps
pitches straighter and he defends the ball to midwicket
pitches and comes in and he pushes the ball to cover
slides down the pads with the angle, Amla is late on the shot
short on the stumps and Amla hops, rolling the wrists on the shot
149ks, rears up off the pitch and Amla does well to leave that
slips in the full delivery that nips back in and Amla pushes it back
on the pads and twirled down to deep square leg extravagantly
pitched up by Hilfenhaus and pushed back solidly
now its back of a length and Amla jabs it to cover
gets onto the toes and punches the ball to the off side, Warner flings himself around at cover and intercepts excellently, then fires back a flat throw
straighter one, Amla shuffles and turns it past midwicket
driven on the rise, superbly, off the front foot square on the off side
four more, this one thumped through extra cover with plenty of oomph
begins with a full toss that Amla bunts straight to midwicket
takes on a short ball, 145ks, but toe-ends it to midwicket
146ks, short and rising and he chases it, beaten completely
vintage Gibbsy! steps out as if this were slow left-arm orthodox, and crashes it through the covers, more timing than power
fullish, on the stumps, and played to right of cover, and a quick single is taken
around off stump, and fullish, Amla defends it solidly
short of a length, on the pads, looks to turn it to leg, but this one gets big on him, and goes to thirdman off the thigh pad
full on the pads, and he has missed out there, turns it straight to short fine
short, down the leg, looks to pull, but this doesn't rise enough, and he misses
fuller, angling into the pads, and pushed to wide of mid-on for an easy single
slower ball, 122ks, on the stumps, and Amla is watchful is defense
just short of a length, on the off, Amla looks to push it through covers, but doesn't get enough room to place it properly
by now he should know you don't ball full on the pads to Gibbs in this form. He just turns his wrists on it, makes sure it is hit in the air, and an easy boundary over square leg
shorter, angled across him, and he plays it into the covers
length ball, angling across Gibbs, and he plays it to left of mid-off for an easy single
short of a length, and Amla turns it to right of mid-on, an easy single ensues
attempts a bouncer, Gibbs looks to pull, doesn't connect properly and just clears midwicket
just short of a length, on the stumps, and for a change Gibbs defends
short outside off, and helped away for a single into the off side

and Gibbs finally plays a false stroke, steps out, Hilfenhaus pulls the length back, Gibbs is short of the pitch and he still goes ahead with the shot, top-edging it to mid-off where Michael Hussey takes a simple catch
short and wide, and Kallis lets it go, quite close to being called a wide
dropped, Kallis gets a short one that sits up, and he pulls it straight to Shaun Marsh at short square leg, but Marsh is late to react, and it deflects off him to midwicket boundary
defended off the back foot cover-point
full, on the stumps, and driven to mid-off
great shot, all wrists, Amla muscling it past Marsh at square leg
144ks, back of a length and he punches it to point
dug in short and Kallis short-arm-jabs it wide of square leg
pitched up this time and he pushes it off the front foot to cover
pitches outside leg stump, he shuffles and works it to midwicket
pitched up on the stumps and he clips it supremely past midwicket
pitched up on off stump and bunted back, Tait deflects it away
pitches and slants into Amla, who shuffles and works it away
back of a length and he pushes it straight to cover
veers straighter and Amla whips it in the air between two fielders
low full toss swinging down leg stump, plays the glance and gets a fine inside edge on it to escort the ball down to fine leg, Tait appeals for something
pushes it to midwicket, he gets across and stumbles, they nearly have a mix-up but the throw is off the mark
pitched up and Kallis punches off the front foot to cover
neat catch at short midwicket! Kallis walks down and across and flicks the ball, but he fails to keep it down and Marsh cups his hands in front of his face to take the catch
pushes at it off the front foot and inside-edges onto front pad
pitched up on off stump, AB drives and inside-edges to mid-on for one
tidy delivery, served up full and this one is watchfully defended
nothing but a push off the front foot, getting to the pitch, and Amla manages to beat a diving cover fielder, he is a touch artiste, this man Amla
overpitched outside off stump and he drives into the covers excellently
reaches out and drives but cannot pierce the gap this time
rather wide and he cuts the ball out to deep backward point
pitches right up there and Amla pushes it straight to cover
straighter delivery whipped across the line but he cant beat midwicket
Tait continues to pitch it up in search of swing but this one is a bit too wide and its clumped off the front foot this time, square on the off side
pitches full and starts to seam in, he defends off the front foot
back of a length and he gets back and turns it past midwicket
short of a length this time and pushed off the back foot to cover
reaches out and slaps the half-volley but Mike Hussey dives well
fantastic batting, this one pitches back of a length on off stump and AB plays a flat-batted, on-the-move swat in front of square leg for a boundary
pitches full and he eases a good-looking steer to deep mid-off
full and very, very wide, AB would've needed a pole to get that
ah, thick outside edge off a slash to a wide one again, lucky shot
gets across to outside off and nudges the ball to midwicket, classy
pitches outside leg stump and deflected to the on side again
exposes leg stump as he walks across the sticks, Johnson pitches outside leg stump once more and AB flicks it down to deep square leg for a single
gets some lift on this one and Amla miscues the attempted flick
hits a good length outside off stump and Amla defends to cover
slants in from off stump, steered with the wrists to midwicket
a tad straighter and now AB knocks it in front of square for a single
pitched up full and he has a flirt at, risky shot and he's beaten
hops back and knifes the ball with those wrists, but midwicket dives
122ks, again angling in to Amla, who turns it to midwicket
punches this one to the off side and Hopes gets across to cut it off
pitches on the dime and that one is turned straight to midwicket
pitches outside off stump and he steers it to backward point
slides into leg stump and he tucks it to the man at midwicket
slips in a short one down the hips and he clips it away for one
much fuller and coming back in and he defends staunchly
pitched up again, a tad wider, and AB square-drives to the fielder
down the pads, turned fine and Hilfenhaus runs in to field
back of a length and he gets back to defend it, inside-edging to leg
gets onto the front foot and carves the ball into the covers
bowls one short and Amla connects from outside off stump, making sure to roll the wrists and pulls into the ground in front of midwicket
hits a fuller length and AB just pats it back with proper defence, then the ball bounces and sits up to catch him on the grill
pitches full and AB drives the ball to the man at cover
144ks, on a length and defended off the toes to the on side
comes forward and steers the ball to extra cover, Warner dives
loose stroke to one pitching back of a length, AB chases and misses as the angle comes back in
a more sensible tap to the off side, and Amla is quick to respond
pitched up and he pushes the ball to the off side
slants back in, AB defends, Amla sets off and gets shooed back
offered some room, Amla maneuvers the ball out to deep third man
pitched up again and AB pinches an easy single, just pushed away
forces that off the back foot, not much foot movement, too much bottom hand on the shot and the ball takes an inside edge and rolls toward midwicket
reaches out to hammer a full delivery through the covers but cocks the wrists and ends up dragging the ball back toward midwicket again
a more conservative approach, shuffling and turning it off his pads
comes onto the front foot and dabs the bat out, angling past gully for one
uses his feet immediately and on-drives the ball down the ground
dropped short and Amla cuts it square though the off side
pushes it through, AB clips across the line and nearly pops a catch back
flatter on the stumps and he shuffles to clip the ball away
tossed up on the stumps and he pushes it to midwicket
comes forward and clips the ball away for a couple
pitched up and defended to the off side, then he sends AB back
plays a loose flirt to one served up a tad wider and fails to connect
pitches on off stump, Amla goes back and flicks it to deep midwicket
gets over a fullish delivery and taps it to the off side, but Amla says no
plays a swat to one outside off stump but cannot beat midwicket
pitches outside off stump and he nudges the ball to backward point
tossed up and he drives hard back to Hussey's left side
rolls the wrists hard and clips it back toward Hussey
tossed up and Amla drives it to extra cover
uses his feet and punches this one down the ground for one
tossed up and defended
flights this one a bit more and AB clips it down to long-on for one
pitches back of a length and he rides the bounce, steering it past point, they run the first one hard and come back for the second, but Hilfenhaus' throw is astray
fuller in length and AB opens the face, dabbing to short third man
now its Amla's turn to open the face and run the ball away for one
pitches on middle and leg and clipped away to the on side with ease
reaches out and drives but cannot find the gaps
pitched up and Amla bunts it in the air wide of Hopes and mid-off
gently tossed up outside off stump and he plays it to the on side
pitches short and he rocks back to cut and so, so narrowly misses
shuffles across and works the ball to midwicket
tosses it up and he goes inside-out in the air over the top of mid-off
gets across and pushes the ball wide of the fielder for one
looped up outside off stump and Amla drives to point
pitches on the toes and he crisply flicks it out to deep square leg
punches a short one off the back foot and fails to beat cover
a tad too wide and he opens the face, steering it to third man
short and wide and flayed out to deep backward point
short of a length, he flashes a cut and miscues it to backward point
slides down the pads and he glances it to deep fine leg
tossed up full and drifting into the stumps, AB closes the face too early and gets a leading edge to the off side for a single that brings up South Africa's 150
reaches out and square-drives the wide delivery past point
pushes the ball away and runs very hard, thats excellent sprinting
swings with the turn and clips it over mid-on for four, top shot
oh thats crunched by AB, rocking back and flat-batting the short ball over midwicket for maximum, and whats more that is his half-century as well, fine knock
tossed up and he clips a single away to square leg
pitches on the stumps and he forces the ball to midwicket
comes forward and drives the ball to Ponting
a bit wider and he plays the ball away to the fielder behind square
hops across and blushes the ball wide of midwicket and sprints
Hilfenhaus tries a short-pitched delivery and that is pulled with ferocity and not a fielder moved, Marsh just didn't pick it with the sun in his eyes
slips in a cutter and AB plays and misses at that one
starts off full outside off, 144ks, Amla toe-ends it to point
gets across to outside off, exposing middle and leg, and flicks it
short of a length outside off stump, he forces it off the back foot
full and wide, AB kneels down and slashes and makes an utter mess
gets a full toss outside off and bunts it to Ponting at mid-off
pitches on and angles across, AB comes onto the front foot, starts to defend and then adjusts to steer the ball into the ground in front of Michael Hussey at first slip
An attempted yorker just outside off, Amla squeezes it to third man
length ball on off, de Villiers drives confidently, but doesn't beat the man at cover
some movement into the batsman after pitching, de Villers gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on
Shot! superbly timed by de Villiers, stands tall and square drives Tait for four
not as pretty this time, ball moves a touch in and de Villiers gets an inside edge , this time to short fine leg
punched towards mid-off by Amla, too much power in the stroke to give the batsmen time to steal a single
starts off wide a wide, full ball, the batsman leans in to a drive towards extra cover
same length but the line is on middle this time, Amla drives inside-out to the covers, mistimed
de Villiers shuffles across the stumps and taps an outside off ball towards mid-on
whoah, wild delivery from Johnson, full toss and very wide outside off
overpitched, on middle and off, pushed towards mid-off for a single, tight single is taken
another nonchalant walk across the stumps from de Villiers, this time to smash Johnson through midwicket
wide outside off, de Villiers reaches for that and cuts it towards cover for a single
attempted swinging yorker, just clipped with an inside edge to the deep
pitches full in search of swing, Amla drives and inside-edges to leg
pitched up again and he flips it to midwicket again, loosely
overpitched on the toes, plenty of swing, and this is flipped away in style
digs it in a short one outside off stump and he drops the hands to leave
pitched up outside off stump and he pushes the ball to extra cover
pitches outside leg stump and he deflects it down to deep fine leg
pitched up and he drives it handsomely to the off side
short down the pads and he swings it wide of square leg
makes some room and punches the ball square through the off side
pitches it up on off stump and AB drives straight to cover
tries a short ball on about leg stump and AB swats it off one leg
short and wide and sliced away, Warner tumbles and intercepts
this time Amla makes no mistake, rising onto the toes and forcing the ball away off the back foot, off the middle of the blade, and picks the gap in front of point
overpitched, understandably, and Amla eases a drive to mid-off
banged in short, sits up off the deck, Amla goes for an uppercut and misses
fuller in length, hint of swing, punched on the rise toward cover
change of pace, just 121ks, almost a yorker length outside off stump, Amla  jams the toe of the bat on it and mistimes it, then pushes it away as it rolls toward the stumps
shuffles across, then back, then forward, and pushes it wide of cover
not a half-volley but Amla punches on the rise past Ponting at mid-off
pitches just back of a length and this time Amla plays it to Ponting
banged in short, up he goes, steering it down in front of first slip
short of a length and Amla gets back onto the toes, shoving the ball back in the air just wide of Tait's left hand, it bounces and runs down the ground, great placement there
another crisp hit from Amla, standing tall and punching into the covers
pitches short and cramps him, he hops up and tucks off the ribs for one
very full on the stumps and AB manages to clip it away for one more
sends down a full toss and he mistimes the shot to midwicket
pitches down leg and straightens, AB adjusts and bunts to the on side
smashed off the front foot and Warner dives excellently at cover
a tad too straight and Amla crisply brushes it off his pads out to the deep
very full and wide and Haddin has to earn his match fee
short of a length and he swats it off one leg and beats square leg
slides down the pads and he cant get bat on it, ball flies to point
pitches on middle and leg and he on-drives it down the ground
another hard-hit on-drive down toward the fielder
swings across the line, cross-bat and all, and midwicket fumbles
banged in short, Amla gets tall and fends it down back the track
full down the pads, clipped away, Hilfenhaus dives at short fine leg and stops but Amla and de Villiers have crossed for the winning single and South Africa win the series!
